definition: to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to recognize/to know/to admit
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
to fall out with sb and become hostile
erhua variant of 認人|认人[ren4 ren2]

sentences.english: From now on, therefore, we regard no one according to the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們從今以後，不憑著外貌認人了。

sentences.english: How do you think your inability to recognize faces affected the development of your social life?
sentences.chinese: 你如何看待無法識認人面對你社交生活發展的影響？

sentences.english: They're revenue driven, not people driven.
sentences.chinese: 他們只認營業收入，不認人。

sentences.english: He is face blind, so he has difficulty recognizing people right away.
sentences.chinese: 他有認人的困難，很難馬上認出誰是誰。

definition: to look for trouble
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to dispute/to refute
to penetrate/to see through
to spend (money or time)
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to turn a blind eye to
unwilling
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to interrogate/to cross-examine/to inquire
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
